frontmatter.title: Inline editable fields
frontmatter.description: Inline editable fields help users to directly jump from read mode to edit mode.

internal.content:
--- title: Inline editable fields description: Inline editable fields help users to directly jump from read mode to edit mode. tabs: ['Usage', 'Code'] showMobile: true --- Inline editable fields enables users to edit the data right where they see it. They come handy when editing a form can be quite frequent and the users want to maintain the context. ### Types
#### Basic input Inline editable input comes with two tiny action buttons to confirm or discard the changes. #### Input with chips Chips can be used as tags in inputs. **Enter/return** key is used to input the tags. #### Dropdown Dropdown type does not require explicit save/discard actions, as the result is saved immediately. ### Sizes Inline editable input comes in **2 sizes** - regular and tiny. On the other hand, inline editable dropdown comes just in the regular size. ### States
#### Basic input ![States of inline editable input](./images/inlineEditableFields-1.png)
#### Input with chips ![States of inline editable input with chips](./images/inlineEditableFields-2.png)
#### Dropdown ![States of inline editable dropdown](./images/inlineEditableFields-3.png)

### Usage
#### Saving changes There are two options to save the changes made - 1. The primary check button 2. The return key on the keyboard #### Discarding changes There are two options to discard the changes made - 1. The secondary clear button 2. The escape key on the keyboard #### Showing error Errors are shown using popovers alongside the input field. ![Errors in inline editable input](./images/inlineEditableFields-4.png)
